column6: Huh.. I didn't even know this place existed..
You really don't know a lot of things// huh...
It's okay! We are here to learn <3

column1: Introduction to the peri line setup
column6: It seems that this patient is in need of a simple IV fluid infusion.
The first thing you should do when setting up a peripheral line is to close the roller clamp.
Before you do that// remember to check the patient info.
Nice! Now// you need to insert the spike into the IV bag.
Okay! I removed the protective cover for the spike!
Hi// how was your experience in the ward
column9: I am surviving the hell shift

column6: I THOUGHT U SAID YOUR SHIFT WAS GOOD
It seems that the skin is very red and swollen. I should clamp the t connector and tell a senior nurse.
Good call! The skin is very red and swollen. Let's stop the IV drip now.
